ygData.subject: Bug: setMassFractions.m: wrong results with string input
ygData.msgSnippet: [This has been crossposted to the Sourceforge bug tracker] It appears that the Cantera-Matlab setMassFractions function doesn t work right if I use a string

From: "brooksmoses1" <brooksmail@...>
Subject: Bug: setMassFractions.m: wrong results with string input
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=151946130
X-Yahoo-Profile: brooksmoses1

[This has been crossposted to the Sourceforge bug tracker]

It appears that the Cantera-Matlab setMassFractions function doesn't 
work right if I use a string such as 'H2:0.5, O2:0.5' as the mass 
fraction specification.  Specifically, I get results as follows:

(GAS_OBJECT is a Cantera gri-mech30 gas object)

>> GAS_OBJECT
[...]
                           X                 Y   
                     -------------     ------------ 
                H2   0.000000e+000     0.000000e+000
                 H   1.000000e+000     1.000000e+000
                 O   0.000000e+000     0.000000e+000
[...]

>> setmassfractions(GAS_OBJECT, 'H2:0.5,H:0.5', 'TP')
[...]
                           X                 Y   
                     -------------     ------------ 
                H2   3.264775e-001     3.333333e-001
                 H   6.529549e-001     3.333333e-001
                 O   0.000000e+000     0.000000e+000
                O2   2.056763e-002     3.333333e-001
                OH   0.000000e+000     0.000000e+000
               H2O   0.000000e+000     0.000000e+000
               HO2   4.471375e-310     7.474886e-309
              H2O2   4.615671e-170     7.951739e-169
                 C   0.000000e+000     0.000000e+000
                CH   0.000000e+000     0.000000e+000
[...]

The results are not particularly consistent; if I re-run the same 
command immediately afterwards, I get the same result, but if I re-run 
it a while later (after having manipulated GAS_OBJECT), I get 
different results.  Also, sometimes adding space in the mass-fraction 
string (e.g., 'H2:0.5, H:0.5') will change the results.

All of my tests have been on version 1.4; however, a colleague of mine 
who is using 1.5.3 confirmed that this problem is reproducable on his 
machine.  Further, my colleague was reproducing the results with 
commands such as "set(GAS_OBJECT,'Y','N2:79,O2:21,CH4:6','T',300,'P',
oneatm)", which implies that the problem is somewhere deep in the 
Cantera code rather than in the Matlab files.

I do note that the setMassFractions function seems to work correctly 
if the mass fractions are specified as a vector; thus, the following 
is what I've been using as a workaround in functions where I want to 
specify the mass fractions as a string:

  setMoleFractions(GAS_OBJECT,Y);
  setMassFractions(GAS_OBJECT,MoleFractions(GAS_OBJECT));

- Brooks
